website_summaries.verdict: With a similar design as the 18", and sturdy build, this middle-of-the-road Fiskars reel mower is worth considering if you need a 17" cut path.
pros: Offers a 17" wide cut path, which may suit some customers better if they prefer a shorter blade width
cons: Price isn't much different than the 18" model

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. After reading so many glowing reviews
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. After reading so many glowing reviews, decided to upgrade from our ancient reel mower. The biggest problem for me was the two sets of wheels, requiring the operator to bear down on the handle to lift the front wheels in order to turn in the opposite direction. On my small, tight lawn, that didn't work very well. Additionally, it is quite heavy so, while easy to push in a straight line for me, the turning was difficult. I wanted to love it, but ended up returning it after one use. My antique mower is easier and more efficient.
customer_reviews.author: S. S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Cuts well and easy to push if grass isn't overgrown.
customer_reviews.text: I have mowed my Bermuda lawn a few times and it cuts effortlessly. Get this if you want the grass to be cut cleanly and/or don't want to kick up allergens. I'm glad I bought this and it makes mowing feel like less of a chore.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Easy enough to push (I'm 60)
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to push (I'm 60), but doesn't cut the weeds that stick up above grass. Very quiet! Will stop if any thing denser that grass gets in blades like twigs, heavy dead leaves, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Magnificent Mower
customer_reviews.text: What a difference between this and my non-Fiskars reel mower. This was super easy to assemble, cuts like a hot knife through butter and is much easier to push. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stefanowicz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap worthless plastic,  breaks on first use
customer_reviews.text: Worst reel mower ever! Broke on the very first use! Not even 5 strips in. Can't cut Ohio grass very well, and it's cheap weak plastic. Adams because its been raining, it's passed the Amazon return window by one day. Unbelievably pissed off. I will never buy a Fiskar product again. I got this because it was so expensive I thought it would be durable. Can't even turn without breaking.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Great mower for "grass" not weeds.
customer_reviews.text: One down side to this is will not cut tall grass and has a hard time with thin weeds. Very easy to push and cuts grass very nice and smooth. I use on 3/4 acre lot with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Hall

customer_reviews.title: Uneven and Leaves Long Pieces
customer_reviews.text: I've tried this mower several times and have never achieved a good even cut. I have tried multiple patterns and heights without luck. My parkway area ground is somewhat uneven, which could be why this mower leaves terrible results. Regardless, I switched to a battery powered black and decker 3 in 1 line trimmer on a mower base and am thrilled with that product. If you have a very small space to maintain the 3 in 1 is a much better option than this reel mower.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just bought one and used it for the first time today. I already had another type of reel mower but the difference between this one and that one is night and day. It cut through most of my grass like and hot knife through butter and it's very easy to push, it even makes less noise than my other reel mower because you'd don't hear a scissoring sound. If you are coming from a gas or electric mower (I've had both) you'll notice that it pushes over most tall stalks so you'll have to cut those down a different way. Overall all I love this mower.
customer_reviews.author: randolph daugherty

customer_reviews.title: Won't cut dandelions!
customer_reviews.text: This mower is nice, if you have regular short grass, but if there's ANY taller grass, or dandelions- it just runs those over, and doesn't cut them at ALL. I've been suffering with this problem for years, and I called Fiskars today, and was told to adjust it in the other direction from where I had it (I had it set for closest to the ground), and then it didn't even cut the regular grass. Again- it cuts regular grass just fine, but for my situation, I guess I need to buy something else.
customer_reviews.author: Harpdude

customer_reviews.title: Do not purchase
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product - blade does not spin freely after first use. Loud clicking noise each time blade spins. If you touch a piece of mulch, blades lock up. Do no purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Hendrickson

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying
customer_reviews.text: This is a cool product. I admit, we have a gentleman come and do our lawn every few weeks...but we bought this because sometimes our grass grows a bit faster and wanted to do touch ups...we are also exercise freaks so figured this could be another form of physical activity. It’s pretty easy to push...my kids 8-10 yr old kids can push it, although on some of the easier settings.. it’s pretty satisfying watching the cut grass flow out, as well as pretty fun..,sometimes I run around and push this in my yard and have “accidentally” cut my neighbors lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Flying Saucer

customer_reviews.title: Great reel mower for smaller yards that cuts even.
customer_reviews.text: I have a very small yard and this thing is awesome to use in between cuttings. Summers are hot here in Texas and I generally mow with a gas mower on those hotter days. Then do a clean up mow in evening with this. Or, is the day is cool I’ll use this as my primary mower. It’s very light and maneuverable. You can see a big difference in the mowers and the reel mower provides a cleaner look on both my Bermuda and Zoysia. Great all around mower, but I personally would be hesitant to use this on something large than a 1/5th acre.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Only works on short sturdy grass, need to change description to say it doesn't cut long grass
customer_reviews.author: becky

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars Reel Mower is what all PUSH mowers should strive for
customer_reviews.text: Fiskars StaySharp Max Reel Mower: This is what all push mowers should strive for. It was easy to push. It cut the lawn. The blades are sharp, very sharp. The one minus that everyone should be aware of is you need to be very careful taking the cutting unit out of the box. There’s a plastic guard so you don’t cut fingers as you take the main unit out of the box but it’s not taped down. As I took the unit out, I ended cutting a piece of my shirt. The plastic guard moved and my shirt touched one of the blades.
customer_reviews.author: CarlosM

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE BELOW!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I like to mow early and this way I don't disturb my neighbors. If you have a smaller, well-maintained lawn this really is a doable solution. Con. After two months the wheel rubber started to shred (see pic) Contacted Fiskar warranty which has been a dead end so fair warning. Update. Changing to 4 stars as Fiskar finally came through and sent me 2 new wheels. Giving credit where credit is due.
customer_reviews.author: JBRO

customer_reviews.title: fragile wheels, heavy
customer_reviews.text: The mower arrived with the wheels broken into many small pieces. I really wanted to like this mower. Like all Fiskars products, the blades are very sharp. But the weight (52 pounds!) is totally unreasonable. Even if I could have replaced the wheels, it just doesn't seem like they would last. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: should have bought this one years ago!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have been mowing with the American Reel mower for 3 years and was hesitant to buy the Fiskars, due to the large price difference. Boy am I kicking myself for not buying this one sooner. It is heavier but MUCH easier to push and cuts MUCH better! Someone said in a review I read before buying and using it, that it was hard or impossible to turn around trees and such, this couldn't be farther from the truth. It turns as well as any push mower or self propelled mower does. If your looking at buying a push Reel mower, buy this one!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shelby Hester

customer_reviews.title: This little thing cuts like no other!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this for the last 3-4 months. Don't think I will ever start up my other gasoline driven mower again. Cuts my grass beautiful. All of my neighbors drive by while I am cutting, probably laughing but comes by weeks later wondering how I keep my grass looking like it came from getting a fresh manicure. Neighbors tell me that they are going to by one now. Only downside......if you have long weeds, you may have to cut over area several times. What I do is push until I am over the weed, stop it and let the rotating blade chop the weed off. Hope this helps others thinking about purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: I want to be green.. But this isn't the way.
customer_reviews.text: I have about half an acre to mow. I am always looking for excercise and ways to be green, so figured this would fit the bill. It worked really well for a few weeks, but over the course of the summer it got duller and duller, and could never handle the quick growing weeds that would get up over 4" in a weeks time. By the end of the summer I had to borrow a gas mower to get my grass back to baseline. like many "green" products, it is a great idea in theory, but it just doesn't get the job done. Too bad. I wanted to love it!
customer_reviews.author: Austin Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Will absolutely not cut moderately high grass.
customer_reviews.text: Mentioned by several others, this mower does a very poor job cutting when grass is more than 4 inches in length. Multiple passes in different directions only result in futility. I believe the problem has to do with the design as there is a crossbar located in the front of the unit that the front wheels attach to. The grass is deflected off the bar which prevents the blades from cutting.
customer_reviews.author: mac

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: I have owned other "conventional design" reel mowers and recognize that this is a different design. It's worth the premium price. It is not lightweight and it is not especially easy to maneuver, but this is not a problem because it is easy to push. I have a fairly steep hill in my backyard and this is easier to handle than my push-mower that has a gas engine. I also like the one lever height adjustment that is easy to use. I have Bermuda grass and this handles it with no problem. For me, this is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: I don't like having to use gas for a mower because it's harmful to the environment. I like this because I don't have to waste gas/electricity on it, it's good for exercise, and without the noise, it's quite peaceful as a form of meditation. I bought this along with a basket and it's easy to install everything if you follow the instructions. I also have a small lawn so this kind of mower is perfect for me
customer_reviews.author: devil_fruit

customer_reviews.title: Cuts Bermuda Grass So Smoothly
customer_reviews.text: The blades on this reel mower are well made. They cut the grass so nicely. It looks like a ride mower went over the yard. It's great quality. We like that one side is almost flat so we can get very close to bricks and landscaping. We are happy we went with 5 blades (after having one with 4 blades for 3 years). The only downside is it is heavy for a smaller person. My husband can handle it easily. It is a bit too heavy for me, in some of the thicker grass. I would still recommend it and have no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: Chris J

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea. Poor execution. Big disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: Nice idea, but has anyone in this production line heard of reasonable tolerances? This thing would be great but one of the blade sections sticks (can't fix by adjusting the whole because the other blades done cut), and the handle wobbles no matter how tight I tighten the bolts. I have a small slope by my fenceline and because of the looseness of the holes, I can't keep the mower from running into the fence. Bottom line, it cuts okay, but is nowhere near as easy as it should be to maneuver, and has manufacturing issues. I'm not used to this kind of quality under the Fiskars brand. I'll be switching to a Ryobi electric next season.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: The most excited I've been about lawn equipment ever!!
customer_reviews.text: The reviews were great and the price was higher than I had hoped for but it was worth every penny. When I took it out of the box, put it together, and started mowing, I had an experience that was as close to a man-gasm that I've ever had with yard equipment. I'm now going on a few years with this mower and I haven't had to sharpen the blade or do any maintenance with it at all. You won't be disappointed with this mower at all and I actually look forward to mowing the lawn with this every week!
customer_reviews.author: rainy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mower!
customer_reviews.text: 2 acres of grass to mow. Oil blades as per instructions upon arrival. Could not be more pleased with this mower! Safe for my kids, dogs, cats to be nearby as I mow. Nice walking work out behind this mower. Easy to maneuver. Quiet. Mower is ready to go at all times. Mows wide variety of grasses/weeds. Double pass necessary for some thicker, overgrown areas. Mows under shrubs neatly with the guard preventing damage to landscaping. I will never go back to motor powered push mower. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: shania

customer_reviews.title: Good little mower. Use for small yards.
customer_reviews.text: Love this so far. Got it yesterday. Took me about 20 minutes to inbox and set everything up. It’s very satisfying to use. I love that it’s quiet and I don’t have to use gas or a cable or anything. I have one small front yard. This is probably not for someone who has a massive yard or has a ton of obstacles/hills. Still not sure how it will do over time. I’ll have to research how to sharpen it. Overall I like it but I wish it could turn. It’s a cut straight against kind thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: 5 minutes to Assemble
customer_reviews.text: By far the best American Lawn Tool. Sturdy, solid, easy maintenance. Best of all 4" manicured high cut. Might get another to race with my wife. 5/25/2020 Update. Works in the rain (See Picture) 5/27/2020 Second Unit -arrived rebuilt, and used with nicks in the blade and chips in the finish. (See picture with red circles)<Left side is rebuilt unit, right side is new unit after I used it for 2 weeks> -Failed paper cut test. (See video)
customer_reviews.author: D D.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Value and Performance
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realize how terrible of a job my rotary mower was doing. My rotary isn't top of the line but it ran around $400 at a big box store. This Fiskars mower is fantastic. Its easy to assemble, sturdy, and my first cut made my lawn look better than ever. It also made cutting back longer bermuda easy with very little scalping. If you have alot of obstacles in your yard this might be alot of effort. I will never go back to the rotary gas mower.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: garbage
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to love this product. I had a reel mower years ago and loved it. This was easy to assemble and initially was easy to use. I have rocks for mulch by my trees. I got too close and hit one of the rocks, and bent the blades. One rock ruined this product, the blades easily bent and now it does not push easily and makes a horrible noise. I have been working to file down the blades where the rock nicked the blade, but I cannot fix it. Something this expensive should not be so sensitive to one little rock. Very unhappy
customer_reviews.author: wvtreehugger

customer_reviews.title: Only for small, flat lawns. I would return if I could.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: simple assembly (took about 15 minutes), easy to push, and will work well enough for small, very flat lawns. Cons: difficult to maneavuer, turn around, or work around any obstacle. It will not cut anything higher than 5-6 inches, even grass. Lawns that aren't perfectly flat will end up with an uneven look when cut. I had to go back over many spots in my yard with a line trimmer to cut down all the things it just wouldn't cut which was surprisingly more than I anticipated. Personally I would return it if I could. I would only recommend for very small laws with minimal weeds and no unevenness.
customer_reviews.author: JCGTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Been using it for months, mine did take a little adjustment out of the box to cut clean but it’s been flawless since. Love cutting the grass at 6 am and not angering neighbors. I will say it’s easy to push as long as you’re not on the 1-2 lowest settings for my tifway hybrid Bermuda, if i try to cut under 1 inch it is very difficult and requires multiple difficult passes to cut.
customer_reviews.author: c crum

customer_reviews.title: Best reel mower on the market in 2020
customer_reviews.text: This thing is what you want - it’s built like a tank, easy to push, no jamming or problems. I had the Scott’s reel mower for two years and finally hated it so much that I went in a search for one that actually worked without jamming al the time. The internet had consensus on this model and the internet was right!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Burn calories and have a nice lawn
customer_reviews.text: This reel mower is great. Its a cake walk to put together with only four bolts and two pins. I had to adjust the blades so that they could cut a piece of paper when I put the machine together and that too was painless. I really like how well it cut the grass though it was kind of high when I first tried the machine. Its not that bad once you start pushing it. It takes a little muscle to get it going. I mostly bought this kind of mower to save money on gas/oil and to burn some extra calories. I used it a couple times now and I really enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: Reeee9000

customer_reviews.title: What is not to love
customer_reviews.text: HA! My Husband was SO mad that I got this. He bet me $200. That I would not be able to mow our lawn in 2 hours. I came home, mowed in my dress and heels, one handed! (Oh he took the bet off the table, trying it before I got home) This little mower is AWSOME! I leave it out when family is here, because it is irresistible, they all try it. No noise, no gas, and excersise. Can I be on a commercial! Lol
customer_reviews.author: GQPC

customer_reviews.title: Love my new mower
customer_reviews.text: I love my new lawn mower. I have St Augustine grass. They recommend a 4” setting. This is the only reel lawn mower I found with a 4 inch setting. It is easy to push. No hassles of gasoline and tune-ups, or an electric cord, or having to charge a battery. And it is quiet, so in the summertime when it stays light later I will be able to mow when I get home from work.
customer_reviews.author: Itwasntme

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying
customer_reviews.text: I've been wanting to try one of these for years. It's very satisfying. However there are some cons... Cant always get right to the edge of where you are mowing. You will need weed eater. There is a learning curve.... I have different type of grass in my front yard and if its damp (dew) you CANNOT push it.... it slides. I have a weed eater and I wait for few to dry now...or work in back yard first...that type of grass is okay when slightly damp. Overall I really enjoy this. (No more running out of gas and I can skip the gym)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hartshorne

customer_reviews.title: Best lawnmower for small lawns
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned this would be hard to push based on past experience with push reel mowers but not so. This is easier to use and cuts my lawn better than my electric rotary mower used to and it's less hassle and takes less time because I don't have to concern myself with the extension cord. I have a 1000 to 1500 sqft of bermuda grass lawn and it takes less than a half an hour to mow and does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: BBillings123

customer_reviews.title: Great mower, bad collection
customer_reviews.text: No question about mower's capabilities about cutting the grass. Obviously no noise, not tougher to push compared to electric or gas mower. There are length settings, so can cut as low as 1". As everyone mentioned, doesn't cut grass longer than 6 inch or so. Now the bad, the grass collector is a separate buy. It collects so little before it is full, my biggest issue with mowing my lawn is not pushing the mower but emptying the bag so frequently. Would have been a 5* if it was any better
customer_reviews.author: NVK

customer_reviews.title: Cut St. Augustine grass very well!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to mow St. Augustine grass for this 69 y/o 5’ 1” woman, get a nice even, clean cut every time. I have a flat yard which helps a lot. Three things I like about this mower are : 1. Quiet! 2. The lovely smell of freshly cut grass instead of exhaust fumes! 3. Good exercise with a beautiful yard as a big bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Coffeeone

customer_reviews.title: I prefer their shovel
customer_reviews.text: I used this 5 times and it began falling apart. Nothing against fiskars... I'm a huge fan of their "worlds greatest shovel", it truly lived up to the hype. This product though, I came away disappointed. Maybe I'm just not ready to embrace the gasoline-free lifestyle yet. I will miss mowing early in the morning when it is still cool. But I'll put up with a little sweat if it means my grass will actually be cut and I can run over anything and everything that stands in my way. Mowing to me is not a labor of love... It's an act of war. One for which this particular mower is not up to task.
customer_reviews.author: disappointed book fan

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I just don't like having a Reel mower
customer_reviews.text: The grass catcher is awful, doesn't really get the job done for a small Chicago yard. Went over the same area a good 5 times for it to be mowed.
customer_reviews.author: Hassan Noorani

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I’m just growing grass after some work done in my yard. I thought this would be great to cut the patchy yard. It will not cut tall small patches it will only cut if set to 1 in and you will destroy the new lawn doing that. It will only cut grass in large patches but only at 1 in otherwise it will only part the grass. So not happy with it. As this is only the second time I’ve used this I wonder if I could get a refund?
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fiskars Reel Mower - One clean cut!
customer_reviews.text: Love this human propelled reel mower. So easy to push and blades seem to stay sharp. I have Bermuda in the front and Zoysia in the back. My landscaper only mows my lawn once a week but in the hot south, to keep your neighbors envious, you really do need to mow every other day. Guess what? I now find myself mowing my small yard every other day. The plus: This is the easiest reel mower to push on the planet and it also cuts down to 1”. Love my Fiskars! ...worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't tighten the bolts enough so I lost a screw and bolt. So tighten them well. It cuts /mulches great. I love just going to the garage and right to mowing. No gas/oil combination needed. No trying to get it started. Quiet. I can hear nature instead of motor. I'm 60 years old in average shape. I had no problem pushing. Some effort needed but I count it as light exercise.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for push-mow-sized yards
customer_reviews.text: I love using this compared to regular gas powered mowers. It's quiet and light enough to move effectively. It doesn't result in as clean of a cut as a gas push mower but I consider that a feature. You do need to mow regularly so that the grass doesn't get high enough that the mower smashes it instead of cutting. It's great compared to the one other reel mower I ever had. I anticipate using it a long time. If only the summers weren't so hot I'd actually like cutting grass.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Instructions were vague and confusing never got it assembled
customer_reviews.text: Screws immediately stripped before we even got it assembled. Assembly looked so simple on the outside of the box, but when you get into the mix of it, the assembly becomes a convoluted mess when the screws that are ill fit don't fit into sockets. Even a worse experience trying to return it. UPS will come to your home lift the box and drop it right back down due to the weight and never ever return it for you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazontee

customer_reviews.title: Product did not work
customer_reviews.text: I did do my homework, so I cannot believe that this product really didn't work. I have used reel mowers before without a problem. This one, however, doesn't budge. Low grass, slightly downhill slope, high cutting setting, you still have to be 200 pounds to get this thing moving and throw in your full body weight. Ended up with sore muscles and not with a cut lawn, and neighbors having good entertainment. Contrary to my habits, I am going to return this product.
customer_reviews.author: MH

customer_reviews.title: Really different but a great cut
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. It took a little getting used to. The cut is totally different than my rotary. The effort to push the reel mower is about the same as my rotary but, keep in mind, I keep my grass low. I've used the mower twice and I'm happy with the look of the cut. I'm glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Bill C

customer_reviews.title: good for work from home person
customer_reviews.text: I slowly gain weight because of work from home - less movement, eat more snacks. I use this mower every other day, to increase my mobility. and it do not use gas/electricity. it is a little heavy, be careful when move it.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Luke

customer_reviews.title: Wonky Handle Video
customer_reviews.text: This is the wonky handle I asked about. A couple people tried to loosen, tighten, adjust to no avail. Is this normal? It doesn't look normal.
customer_reviews.author: PinkMango

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good!!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have only used it twice and don't use it for the whole yard. My son has a riding mower and he cuts the majority of the yard with that. This works good for the "islands" by the street. I am a 70 year old woman and have no problem at all pushing this.
customer_reviews.author: Judith S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality reel mower. Easy to push.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Quality. I bought it to replace an old Brill reel mower so I am used to pushing a manual reel mower and know it’s limits. This Fiskars mower is MUCH easier to push and cut because of its chain and gear system (my 7 year old had no problem using it), but because of that chain and gear it is a bit heavier. On a well-groomed lawn (cut often and weed free) this mower is like cutting each blade of grass with scissors. Perfect even cut like a golf course. If you like the idea of a reel mower but don’t want to sweat as much with a traditional reel mower, this is the right product.
customer_reviews.author: sephir hamilton

customer_reviews.title: For Reel Mower this one is Great
customer_reviews.text: Jon's review is very accurate: Wish I Knew Before I Bought, because he is spot on in his comments. The mower is great but requires learning a different way to cut your yard. My grass looks great, it is 99% as good as a gas mower. But it is not as good as gas, I have to cut some stranglers and clean up some loose ends. But it is worth it! No noise, no gas, good for environment, costs less than gas, and is just a cool way to cut your yard. I have not found a grass catcher for the back of it, the American Mower Grass Catcher does not work with Fiskar Reel Mower.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: you will look forward to mowing
customer_reviews.text: this mower is absolutely great!!! really easy to assemble, took about 10 minutes. make sure to do paper cut test to make sure cutting correctly. but mine was perfect and did not need adjusting. was recently 70 degrees in Rhode island yesterday!! yes in January, and could not believe how good this mower cut. the quality of cut is amazing. if I had double cut it would have been even better, but for just one cut, everything looked uniform. I like to exercise, but hate doing cardio at the gym, this machine will give you the burn and you will look forward to mowing. Great product Fiskars!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me and have a hard time pulling the starter cord on a traditional lawnmower, try this! It makes no noise and I was able to assemble it (in my living room) in less than 20 minutes. I agree with some reviewers that the cut isn't always even, but my back yard is about the size of a postage stamp, so it's not all that important to me whether I have to mow over a section twice. Super lightweight and easy to maneuver with 3 grass heights. I set my other mower out on the curb and only use this one now.
customer_reviews.author: Adventuregirl7

customer_reviews.title: Grass looks amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I have never owned a reel mower, but a friend of mine bought one and said that his grass looked so much better after using one. He said that his lawn no longer had those "swirl marks" you get from a rotary mower. I took the plunge and bought this Fiskars reel mower. It goes through the grass like butter, no matter how high the grass is. It is a bit on the heavier side, but fairly easy to maneuver. Assembly was a breeze and it only took me a few minutes. I do recommend wiping down the blades afterward if your grass is wet, otherwise the blades will rust.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great mower!
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to push. Taller grass takes some more tenacity but not bad at all. Completely silent, no oil, no gas, and some cardio. I'd say great for yards under an acre and for people who care about the environment and their health. My quarter of an acre takes around 40 minutes or less. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I like the quiet operation and effective straight line cutting. I like the fact you don't need to fuss with gas, batteries or cords. That said, it does take a little more push and time than a power mower. It's not as easy to trim tight spaces and (of course) it only works going forward, but it does cut (dry) grass. I mow a fairly flat, quarter acre lawn once a week, and so far, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: John Alberts

customer_reviews.title: Love this Reel mower!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it for the first time today. Grass was wet, and way over grown so I started with it at a tall setting and worked my way down. Worked amazing. Super impressed with how well it cut. I always mowed at a fast pace, so this is perfect for me. Very quiet too. I used the attachment to catch the grass and it worked well. If you are thinking about going with a reel mower, this is the one. Yes it costs more, but it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Best backyard push mower ever
customer_reviews.text: Got this push mower because we didn't want to get another gas mower or an electric mower. The set up for the chain drive can be a little tricky, but once you get it working this is one of the best push mowers ever. We got this on a friend's recommendation and now are recommending it to others as well.
customer_reviews.author: DiDi K

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty easy to set up - I did do one thing wrong and had to unassemble one piece and then reassemble but it was due to not clearly reading/following the directions. This is easy to use and it cuts like a dream! It was FUN to mow my lawn!!
customer_reviews.author: Karen M.

customer_reviews.title: Quality reel mower. Innovative design.
customer_reviews.text: Likes: ease of use no sound/smell when operating. Works as advertised no complaints in performance. Quality feels on par for Fiskars. The weight is nice as I dont have a very smooth lawn it seems to help cut more evenly being a bit heavier. The mower bag doesn’t come off easily it would be nice if it did. As long as it still held as secure as it does now. Not a big deal, 3 ha dfuls of grass and your good to go again.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Hewes

customer_reviews.title: Great mower, if you don't get a defective one
customer_reviews.text: It would be 5 stars but the first one I received I wasn't able to adjust the height due to a manufacturing defect (pieces that shouldn't overlap were hitting each other). I had to repack it and send it back to Amazon and got another one that's fine. Mine mows well out of the box but you may have to adjust the blades (not the height adjustment but the blade adjustment). I don't think the instructions are great for explaining how to adjust the blades but there are lots of videos online if you are unsure. Overall great little mower but maybe check the local hardware stores before ordering in case you have the send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Smith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Small Lawns
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Greatly improved over the push mower I used 60 years ago. I bought this to use on my small lawn when it is too wet to use my rechargeable mower. This push mower covers the lawn quickly, cleanly; and it cleans easily. I really don't need my battery mower any longer.
customer_reviews.author: ABChwhite

customer_reviews.title: Could be great if not the faulty design
customer_reviews.text: I really like so much about this mower. It's quiet. Relatively easy to push my 6-yr. old can help mow. However, the settings won't drop down to 1 inch. One of the bolts slightly bows out so it catches and won't go all the down. As a result, we have to mow twice a week! Finally, the wheels are such that when we turn around, they mark up the grass. It would be better if they could turn easily and not drag. I reached out and haven't heard back from Fiskars...
customer_reviews.author: Sam Choi

customer_reviews.title: I like it but its not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I like that I can mow my small lawn quickly without the noise of a gas mower. I can listen to music or books while I mow with this mower. I did buy the separate grass catcher because this is not able to mulch and so I didn't want the big pieces of grass left on my lawn. Also the design of the handle is strange. it doesn't lock in place so it wants to tilt forward when I am trying to push the mower. I wish the handle could lock in place.
customer_reviews.author: Matson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I've got a small yard and this thing works great. One piece of advice, read everything that you get with the mower after assembly, not just the assembly instructions. Be sure that nothing hard (rocks etc..) are in the lawn at blade level. Hitting something hard with the blades will put a little burr in the sharpener or blade, and you'll end up with a metal file in hand performing the repair. So, please read all instructions..
customer_reviews.author: Eli M

customer_reviews.title: Good mower
customer_reviews.text: I gave away my very old reel mower before I moved. This new one is great ! Such an improvement over my old clunky one. I'm 70 years old and have no problem mowing my front and back yards with it. I do make sure the grass doesn't get too high between mowing. Very happy with this purchase !
customer_reviews.author: TJ Vick

customer_reviews.title: however it tackled the horrible grass easily and quickly
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this mower twice, however it tackled the horrible grass easily and quickly! Easy to assemble. No tools necessary. Parts move with ease. Height of cut is very easy to adjust. Cuts through magnolia leaves like it's a hot knife to warm butter! Small twigs don't effect it. Only given 4 stars as I haven't had full time to ensure its durability and tall weeds that are thick and straw like didn't cut with it - so few on my lot it's not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa

customer_reviews.title: The best thing about it is that it utilizes a chain ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried another style of reel mower, but this one is far more user friendly. The best thing about it is that it utilizes a chain drive system to spin the blade, so it is possible to "rev" the reel up for certain areas of my yard. I do wish it had a larger deck, but it is the only reel mower I found to mow at a 4" height (recommended for my Fescue lawn in the summer). As much as I hate needing to use a reel mower due to my allergies, this is the best it can get for the category.
customer_reviews.author: Anne K

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Box had a "repaired" hole in it when it arrived. Unboxed and assembled handle then attached to mower. Rear wheels would not rotate going forward, they just slid along. They did work in reverse though, so I removed the chain cover to see what was going on. Chain was jammed, it was off the sprocket. After raising the tensioner, I was able to get the chain back on. Wheels now rolled properly, but the pulley/sprocket was either warped or bent and would wobble during operation. Submitted warranty claim to Fiskars - will update review with resolution.
customer_reviews.author: EK

customer_reviews.title: Best for perfectly flat lawn.  Even slight incline is a problem.
customer_reviews.text: We had hoped this product would work on our very small yard that has a few minor sloping areas. My husband is tall so he has the handle positioned in such a way that when pushing the mower up our small incline the handle folds in. There should be a way to lock the folding handle. Otherwise it cuts OK except for the fine seed heads, which is annoying. I think we'll stick with our regular Honda mower from now on.
customer_reviews.author: swxup

customer_reviews.title: Mow like a girl!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 64 yr old woman. I received my mower, assembled it and mowed my back yard today. I have to say, this is probably the 2nd time I've ever mowed in my life so I don't have anything to compare to, but I am impressed with the easy assembly and the ease of mowing. I would recommend this mower to anyone who does not want to deal with the mechanics of a gas or electric mower.
customer_reviews.author: jwilli

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and easy to use. I'm a senior and can mow with this. Of course, it's absolutely silent and I love that! It adjusts height with ease and cuts well. We had an issue with the first one we bought and the return process was extremely customer friendly. Another one was sent out and received in two days. This is not you old fashioned reel mower! I was amazed!
customer_reviews.author: Catharine

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: When the grass gets thick you might need to do 2 passes at different heights but honestly impressed at the job it does. The grass looks way better than the gas mower. the adjustment knob is kind of cheap but the rest of it's built well. It's expensive but well worth it since you don't need to start it or service the carb etc
customer_reviews.author: Genericusername

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mower because I did not want a gas mower that was going to pollute. This mower is really high quality. I have a small, clean yard (no trees and few rocks/twigs), but I've mowed the lawn a few times, and this mower worked great. It's great exercise as well.
customer_reviews.author: djsh4dowfan

customer_reviews.title: Cuts great
customer_reviews.text: This mower does cut well, but it also pushes the grass down where the wheels go and causes a crazy look to your yard when the grass pops back up, which takes a day or two, so you have to go back over it again. Seems like a constant battle to keep the grass even, ended up getting a gas mower instead, but this is a great little mower for upkeep of the yard, the in between trims.
customer_reviews.author: DC NW BASSIN

customer_reviews.title: Damage to product
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I really do like this product. It works well, however; it was slightly damaged. The right rear wheel is bent inward. Not enough to keep the product from working but for the price there should not have been any issues. There was no damage to the box so it was a defect in the production of the product. Love the fact that the grass discharges forward rather than back on your feet. Also, I should mention, It does not do well in taller thick grass and weeds.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Failed on taller grass and weeds. Missed the cut do to design issues
customer_reviews.text: Bought the for our cabin which is 80% moss covered and 20% grass mixed in. Total failure in design for cutting tall grass and/ weeds. The front bar on the mower pushes the taller grass over — and misses the cut completely. Can’t even return it cause the box is gone. Unless your cutting your lawn regularly with this...stay away from it.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Fast and quiet...great product.
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for a small lawn, and he loves it. It's fast and quiet, so he can mow early in the morning, and late at night, and not have to worry about disturbing the neighbors. It was a better price on Amazon than it was in local stores too!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels rickety
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this mower, I really liked it. It's not too heavy, pretty easy to push, and best of all—no gas! But pushing it around, especially when I try to turn, it feels like a toy—super rickety and cheap. When I was mowing today, a bolt fell off (I had tightened them perfectly) and the half the handle just came right off. Not the quality I'd expect from Fiskars.
customer_reviews.author: Ines

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but has some serious flaws
customer_reviews.text: I like the cut. If I had an 18" x 100 yard lawn, it would be perfect. But it doesn't turn well, because you can't pick the front wheels up to pivot on the rear. I'm thinking about trying to modify the "legs" so that when you push down on the handle, the front wheels tip up. Another thing...because of this non-turning...the wheels make an absolute mess of concrete...after I just pressure washed my driveway two weeks ago! Come on, Fiskars...this could be a perfect mower...if you'd just put a bit more work into it.
customer_reviews.author: BRYCE P CORBIN

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could review the Fiskar mower but...
customer_reviews.text: When I opened the delivered box, the internal box definitely didn't look right (see picture). On further examination, not only was there no real parts to put together to make a mover, the mower isn't even a Fiskers. Very disappointed in this situation and I am absolutely confused how this could happen. Now I have to go through the pain of shipping it back to amazon and go another week without my lawn being mowed.
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised how easy this mower is to use and how great the cut is for my lawn.
customer_reviews.text: I had to mow my dad's lawn as a teen with a push reel mower. This mower is nothing like that old one I had to use. This mower is amazingly easy to use for a push mower and my lawn looks equally amazing. I now have a lawn that is fairway quality. I would highly recommend this mower to anyone that does not wish to use a gas-powered mower or wants a reel mower quality cut on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Tittle

customer_reviews.title: Great design!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mower. Simple elegance in design and functionality. This mower is easy to use and clean. I also got the bagger and I love both. Light weigh an its easily maneuverability make it a great mower. Great quality and design!
customer_reviews.author: Brooklyn568

customer_reviews.title: One man powered... mower
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of purchasing a reel mower especially when it’s at this price point. It is slightly different from using a gas mower. The effort to push it is about the same maybe a little easier. If the grass is 5 inches or less it cuts it with little effort. If it’s taller you are going to have to go over the same spot several times. It’s really quite so I don’t feel bad using it early in the morning. I’m sure my neighbors appreciate that. It also feels good knowing I’ll never need to buy spark plugs, air filters or gas again. Well, not for the mower anyway.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Flat out awesome
customer_reviews.text: I'd give this 6 stars if I could. Works very well. Very quiet so I can mow early in the morning to avoid the Houston heat. Keep the grass cut to a reasonable height and this mower does a great job. If you let the grass (or weeds) get more than 4 or so inches high, it won't get them all. Also works better when the grass is growing well and is nice and thick. That seems to help keep the blades of grass supported vertically better so the mower doesn't push them over without cutting.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Falkenhagen

customer_reviews.title: Handles short fine grass and early spring growth well
customer_reviews.text: Does an OK job. Handles short fine grass and early spring growth well. Does not cut any taller weeds or shoots with a larger diameter to them. If you have a highly kept grass only lawn this would do OK, but if you have some weeds mixed in or some less desirable grasses it just won't keep things cut. FYI - Raising the cutting height and trying multiple passes didn't help nor did setting blade alignment and spacing per the manufacturers instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Coign

customer_reviews.title: It cuts outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I am really impressed and happy with this product because it met my expectations and more. I have had experience using reel mores before and this one is the best I have ever used thanks to the chain driven wheels. The adjustable handle position is a great feature to have when you multiple people of different sizes using the mower. Hight adjustments for the reel is easy I just wish the gave you more indication of hight other then 1 and 4 inch's.
customer_reviews.author: connor james

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Got it, immediately put it together and mowed 1/2 acre yard. My yard is no where even level. It is bumpy and rough. Needless to say this mower did a great job. Unlike the riding mower and push mowers that are getting repaired. I know I can easily mow the lawn anytime with this. The thicker patches of grass had to be mowed twice, but I have to do that with regular mowers also. Was able to answer a call and keep mowing the lawn, so quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only for perfect lawns
customer_reviews.text: This mower is for a perfectly flat lawn and thick grass, even the littlest bumps or divets and it misses spots. My front yard is flat but the grass is thinning and it just sweeps across it, currently trying to sell it.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: Well made but overpriced for the cut it gives compared to much cheaper models. The stabilizer wheels being in front cause problems of digging in at times. If you have a perfect level graded lawn it wouldn't be a problem. I chose this model because I knew it would be well made. Should of went with another lower-priced unit.
customer_reviews.author: M. COLLINS

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: I've sharpened it after each mowing season and it performs every time. Just know that this is a reel mower and require you to PUSH it. It's not a powered mower that you can just walk behind. You are turning the blades, not a motor. So, when the grass gets a little high, you're going to have to push harder. Keep the blades sharp and your grass will look great. Not recommended for a large yard though.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Hassle-free replacement process
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this mower almost two months ago, but the original product arrived damaged. The sproket was bent and the chain had come off so the mower was unusable. I processed the replacement, adjusted the delivery date, and the replacement mower arrived the next week! I was able to assemble the mower by myself without any issues, and after a first pass on my lawn I couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Starts off great but wears out fast.
customer_reviews.text: Started off great but the blades dulled pretty fast. Now it gets caught on even short grass and comes to a halt. Makes it impossible to cut the lawn because I have to go over the same patch again and again. To get anywhere requires a lot of force to get it moving and my wife refuses to use it. We got an electric mower instead that's light and easier for everyone involved. Really was a waste of money because now it's just collecting dust in the garage.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Trudeau

customer_reviews.title: Choppy Cut
customer_reviews.text: Because of the "ease to push", the blades rotate slower. The choppy cut looks horrible. Don't buy if you care about the look of your lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Pass This By
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this reel mower incredibly heavy and hard to maneuver, it is not well made. After just ten mows of a very small lawn with low grass the reel completely locked down on the bed. I cannot rotate the reel at all. This after less than two total hours of use. Now I am attempting to return to Fiskars as this broke literally the day after my return window to Amazon closed. PS: Don't bother going to the technical support page at Fiskars: there isn't one.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Demers

customer_reviews.title: great buy
customer_reviews.text: my brother says it cuts much better thank the old one from same company..
customer_reviews.author: TRomelle

customer_reviews.title: Cover arrived cracked
customer_reviews.text: Received a beat-up box that was held together with packing tape. The grass shoot was cracked beyond repair. I contacted Fiskar and they replaced the part quickly. The customer service was excellent. The lightweight mower is perfect for small yards and my 15-year-old daughter loves using it on our lawn.
customer_reviews.author: Donna

product_meta.title: Fiskars 17 Inch StaySharp Plus Reel Mower (6207)
product_meta.description: Size:StaySharp Plus -17 inch| Style:StaySharpThe StaySharp Plus Reel Mower combines patent-pending technology with superior ergonomics to deliver best-in-class cutting performance without gasoline, oil, charging, the hassle of cords or the noise created by other mowers. It features an InertiaDrive Reel for 75% more cutting power than standard reel mowers; StaySharp Cutting System to eliminate the cost and inconvenience of annual blade sharpening; and a unique grass discharge chute that throws clippings forward cleanly, away from your feet. The combination of these technologies makes the StaySharp Plus Reel Mower 40% easier to push than other reel mowers, helping you get more done with less effort.
feature_bullets: The smart design of reel mower offers a cleaner cut without the hassles of gasoline, oil, battery charging, electrical cords or loud engine noise
A combination of advanced technologies make the staysharp plus reel mower 40-percent easier to push than other reel mowers
Patent-pending inertia drive reel delivers 75-percent more cutting power to blast through twigs, weeds and tough spots that would jam other reel mowers

Exclusive StaySharp Cutting System uses precision-ground, hardened steel blades to cut grass without touching, greatly reducing friction and blade wear for long-lasting performance without costly annual blade sharpening
Unique grass discharge chute throws clippings forward cleanly, away from your feet

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars954 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
